availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Morton, Sr. (Mason County, Kentucky, planter)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, planter. Virginia native. Married to Lucy B. Morton Morton in Mason County, Kentucky, on October 3, 1816. Father of Hannah B. Morton Duke. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Mason County in 1840. Household owned five enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons, including Alice [Unknown], in Mason County in 1859. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Household owned forty enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860.
